input.description: XML document conforming to the Connection Details Concept that contains the information required to execute a command via command line.
The name of the interface to change. This is the name obtained from ifconfig or ipconfig.
The password used to enter the "enable" mode on the router
An XML document containing the prompts used to enable and interact with a device.

output.description: XML document consisting of one or more <line> elements that contain the command response. Each <line> element contains an index attribute indicating the order in which the information was returned by the command.
Did the operation Succeed? Valid value: true.

xslt-stylesheet.stylesheet: <xsl:stylesheet xmlns:xsl="http://www.w3.org/1999/XSL/Transform" version="1.0"> <xsl:output indent="yes" /> <xsl:template match="/"> <fat-command> <commands os-id="Cisco IOS"> <command> <xsl:text>terminal length 0</xsl:text> </command> <command prompt="prompt1"> <xsl:text>enable</xsl:text> </command> <command prompt="prompt2">${enable password}</command> <command prompt="prompt3"> <xsl:text>config terminal</xsl:text> </command> <command prompt="prompt4"> <xsl:text>interface ${interface name}</xsl:text> </command> <command prompt="prompt4"> <xsl:text disable-output-escaping="no">no shutdown</xsl:text> </command> <command prompt="prompt3"> <xsl:text>exit</xsl:text> </command> <command prompt="prompt2"> <xsl:text>exit</xsl:text> </command> </commands> <command os-id="Windows Default"> <xsl:text disable-output-escaping="no">netsh interface set interface name="${interface name}" admin=enabled</xsl:text> </command> <command os-id="Linux"> <xsl:text disable-output-escaping="no">/sbin/ifconfig ${interface name} up</xsl:text> </command> <command os-id="SunOS"> <xsl:text disable-output-escaping="no">/usr/sbin/ifconfig ${interface name} up</xsl:text> </command> </fat-command> </xsl:template> </xsl:stylesheet>

documentation.description: Change the state of the interface to down.
